{{title|INFINITY}}
{{cpp/numeric/math/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header | cmath}}
{{dcl | since=c++11 |
#define INFINITY /*implementation defined*/
}}
{{dcl end}}

If the implementation supports floating-point infinities, the macro {{tt|INFINITY}} expands to constant expression of type {{c|float}} which evaluates to positive or unsigned infinity.

If the implementation does not support floating-point infinities, the macro {{tt|INFINITY}} expands to a positive value that is guaranteed to overflow a {{c|float}} at compile time, and the use of this macro generates a compiler warning.
